name: University of Central Missouri
about: The University of Central Missouri's Department of Aviation offers a renowned Professional Pilot program, grounded in over 50 years of tradition and history. Located at the Max B. Swisher Skyhaven Airport, the only university-owned airport in Missouri, students benefit from hands-on learning and access to a fleet of aircraft, including C-172s and B58s, as well as state-of-the-art Frasca and Redbird flight simulators. The program is accredited by the Council on Aviation Accreditation (CAA) and boasts a 100% job placement rate for pilots. With a strong emphasis on safety, critical thinking, and teamwork, UCM prepares students for successful careers as professional pilots or in aviation management, ensuring they are well-equipped to navigate the complexities of modern flight operations. UCM's aviation program is a gateway to an exciting and rewarding career in the aviation industry.
